New Records: Dion Myers scored his first half-century in T20Is.
Key Match Events: Shubman Gill scored a 49-ball 66 opening the batting.
Washington Sundar took three wickets for 15 runs.
Avesh Khan took two wickets for 39 runs.
Ravi Bishnoi took a spectacular flying catch at backward point.
Riyan Parag took a sharp catch at slip to dismiss Johnathan Campbell.
Pre-Game Insights: The return of three players from the T20 World Cup-winning squad forced a change in India's tactics.
Jaiswal slotted back at the top with Gill, resulting in Abhishek Sharma and Gaikwad playing out of positions at Nos. 3 and 4.
Post-Match Reflections: India took a big step towards winning the five-match T20I series against Zimbabwe with a 23-run win in the third match to take a 2-1 lead.
Jaiswal felt that the score of 182 was enough at the innings break.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India benefited from 31 runs due to Zimbabwe's fielding errors.
India faced 22 dots in the powerplay but still managed a fast start.
Zimbabwe's fielding mishaps included missed half-chances and dropped catches.
India's decision to accommodate all of their T20 World Cup returnees left them thin on bowling resources.
